title: TACO vs WACO: Trump‚Äôs $50b tariff windfall - but will it last for US?
content: Donald Trump's tariff policy boosts US revenue. Customs duties hit a record $64 billion in the second quarter of 2025. Most nations avoid retaliation, preferring negotiation. China and Canada initially resisted but later retreated. The US leverages its market dominance. Concerns rise about potential long-term economic costs. The world awaits the next tariff deadline. Escalation risks remain high.

title: Bihar polls: Why Nitish Kumar's caste survey was a political masterstroke
content: Nitish Kumar's political resilience in Bihar stems from his ability to cultivate a broad support base beyond his Kurmi caste. By championing the Extremely Backward Classes (EBCs) and implementing targeted schemes, he has positioned himself as their leader.

title: Russia oil squeeze: Trump‚Äôs 100% tariff threat - should India panic?
content: Amidst Trump's threat of secondary tariffs on countries trading with Russia, will India's crude oil supply face uncertainty? Russia has become India's top oil supplier due to discounted rates, potential tariffs could disrupt this. However, India's diversified procurement, strategic reserves, and growing oil imports from other markets may mitigate the impact, suggesting resilience against supply shocks.

title: Ranchi remembers the man who taught Dhoni 'iconic helicopter shot'
content: Ranchi commemorated Santosh Lal, known as Bunty, on his 12th death anniversary, the man who taught MS Dhoni the iconic helicopter shot. Bunty's innovative wrist technique, learned on local grounds, became Dhoni's signature move, despite Santosh's own notable domestic career. Fans remember Bunty's contribution, acknowledging that the shot might not have existed without him.

title: Intel layoffs: Company job cuts cross 5,000 in July; numbers rise 4x in‚Ä¶
content: Global semiconductor giant Intel is implementing a significant restructuring plan, resulting in over 5,000 layoffs across US locations including California, Oregon, Arizona and Texas. The job cuts, impacting engineers, senior leaders, and back-office staff, aim to streamline operations and address financial losses. This follows 15,000 job cuts earlier in 2024, bringing the total to over 20,000.

title: Khelo Bharat Conclave | ‚ÄòPut nation first...‚Äô - Mandaviya's stern message to NSFs
content: Sports Minister Mansukh Mandaviya urged national sports federations to prioritize national interest over personal egos to elevate India as a global sporting powerhouse by 2047. Addressing the 'Khelo Bharat Conclave,' he emphasized good governance and collaborative planning, highlighting the upcoming National Sports Governance Bill.

title: Meta‚Äôs AI hiring spree: Mark Zuckerberg to critics; You think it‚Äôs money?
content: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg refutes claims that hefty paychecks are the primary draw for AI researchers joining Meta. He asserts that access to unparalleled compute power and the opportunity to develop 'superintelligence' are the key motivators. Zuckerberg highlights Meta's offering of 'infinite GPUs,' small, impactful teams, and freedom to experiment, attracting top talent from rivals like OpenAI and Google DeepMind.

title: IND vs ENG: Not Bumrah, Team India coach calls this speedster 'a lion'
content: Jasprit Bumrah's prowess has been a major talking point ahead of the India-England series, but assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate has highlighted Mohammed Siraj's significant contributions. Despite not always having the expected returns, Siraj's lion-hearted approach and ability to create opportunities make him a vital asset to the Indian bowling attack.

title: India slams Nato chief's warning on trade with Russia; flags 'double standards'
content: External affairs ministry has cautioned against double standards following NATO chief Rutte's warning of potential secondary sanctions for countries, including India, maintaining trade ties with Russia. Rutte urged India, China, and Brazil to reconsider their economic relations with Moscow or face sanctions if Russia doesn't engage in peace talks.

title: What‚Äôs troubling Apple: Economist on Tim Cook‚Äôs factory puzzle; ‚ÄòIndia or China?'
content: Economists criticize Apple's shift towards political appeasement under Trump's pressure, with CEO Tim Cook prioritizing relationships over innovation. Concerns arise over 'corny capitalism,' where political favor dictates corporate success. Apple's supply chain diversification plans in India face hurdles as Foxconn withdraws Chinese engineers, potentially hindering iPhone production and technology transfer, amidst Beijing's efforts to curb exports to India.

title: 'Old news': Russia rolls eyes at US sanctions threat over Ukraine war
content: Russia has downplayed the threat of new US sanctions, dismissing them as commonplace. This reaction follows President Trump's 50-day ultimatum for Russia to negotiate a peace agreement with Ukraine, coupled with a NATO-backed military aid plan for Kyiv. Trump warned of imposing tariffs on Russia‚Äôs trading partners if no deal is reached, as the conflict continues without resolution.

title: 'Morale of criminals sky-high': After meeting Nadda, Chirag slams ally Nitish
content: Chirag Paswan has strongly criticized Bihar's deteriorating law and order situation, citing the Paras Hospital shooting as evidence of criminals openly challenging the administration. He expressed deep concern over the rising crime rate, especially with upcoming elections, and urged the government to take immediate action.

title: Shaquille O‚ÄôNeal threatens to punch Robert Griffin III over Angel Reese
content: NBA legend Shaquille O'Neal has issued a stern warning to former NFL quarterback Robert Griffin III over his negative comments and a racist social media post targeting WNBA player Angel Reese. O'Neal, angered by Griffin's actions, particularly the reposting of a derogatory image, threatened physical violence if Griffin continues his behavior.

title: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce stand in solidarity with singer‚Äôs dad Scott
content: Taylor Swift prioritized her family as her father, Scott Swift, underwent a quintuple bypass surgery last month. She paused her Eras Tour obligations to be with him, along with her mother, Andrea, and brother, Austin. Travis Kelce, her boyfriend, offered his support during this challenging time, as the family focused on Scott's recovery following the procedure.

title: Luka Doncic might walk from the Los Angeles Lakers. Here's why
content: Luka Doncic's future with the Los Angeles Lakers is uncertain as he approaches a player option in 2025-26. Tension arises from the Lakers' apparent shift towards prioritizing Doncic over LeBron James, potentially alienating the Slovenian star. Concerns grow that the Lakers' treatment of James could impact Doncic's trust and willingness to commit long-term.

title: Exclusive | 25 female footballers sharing an apartment, now in India‚Äôs top tier: Story of Garhwal FC
content: Garhwal FC, a Delhi-based women's football team, has defied expectations by qualifying for the Indian Women‚Äôs League (IWL) a year ahead of schedule. Overcoming limited resources and humble living conditions, the team achieved an undefeated season, winning all 24 matches. Coach Akshay Unni's focus extends beyond football, prioritizing the development of his players as individuals.

title: Viral: Astronomer CEO caught 'cheating' with his HR chief at Coldplay concert
content: Astronomer CEO Andy Byron and his company's Chief People Officer Kristin Cabot were caught on camera at a Coldplay concert in Boston, sparking affair rumors. ‚Äã‚Äã"Oh look at these two," Chris Martin commented without knowing that they were not married to each other. The video has gone viral with social media users wondering what happened next to Byron who is married and has kids.

title: IND vs ENG: Jasprit Bumrah available for 4th Test? Check details
content: Team India's assistant coach, Ryan ten Doeschate, revealed that Jasprit Bumrah's availability for the crucial fourth Test at Old Trafford will be decided in Manchester. The decision hinges on factors like weather conditions, the team's best chance of winning, and a holistic view of the last two games in the series, considering Bumrah's preferred shorter spells.

title: BJP-UBT reunion? Uddhav meets Fadnavis day after CM's 'invite' to rejoin Mahayuti
content: Amidst political shifts in Maharashtra, Devendra Fadnavis has extended an invitation to Uddhav Thackeray's Shiv Sena UBT to rejoin the ruling coalition. This comes after Thackeray met with Chief Minister Shinde, sparking speculation about a potential reconciliation. Fadnavis emphasized the BJP's stability until 2029, suggesting an opportunity for Thackeray to reconsider alliances.

title: IND vs ENG: India‚Äôs playing XI in limbo! Arshdeep's injury throws selection into chaos
content: During a net session in Manchester, Arshdeep Singh suffered a cut on his bowling hand while attempting to stop a shot, raising concerns about his availability for the fourth Test. The medical team is evaluating the injury to determine if stitches are needed, which will significantly impact India's team composition and planning for the upcoming match at Old Trafford.

title: 'Respect sensitivity of the loss': AAIB slams foreign media coverage of AI crash probe
content: The Air India crash investigator has criticized international media outlets for their "selective and unverified" reporting on the recent Air India crash. This rebuke follows a report by the Wall Street Journal suggesting the pilot cut fuel flow to the engines.

title: How Epstein files broke Trump's love affair with MAGA
content: On Truth Social, Trump lashed out at his own supporters, calling those demanding transparency over Epstein‚Äôs files ‚Äúweaklings‚Äù who had ‚Äúbought into this b*******, hook, line, and sinker.‚Äù The insult stunned many longtime allies. Even the usually sycophantic Trump War Room refused to repost the outburst, a silent sign of discomfort within the inner sanctum. What was once a unified political religion now resembles a schismatic cult.

title: IND vs ENG: Big update on Pant‚Äôs injury! Team India may have to take tough call
content: Team India's assistant coach, Ryan ten Doeschate, has confirmed that Rishabh Pant is nearing full fitness before the fourth Test against England. Despite a finger injury sustained during the Lord's Test, Pant batted with pain and scored a valuable 74. The decision on whether he will keep wickets in Manchester is yet to be made, prioritizing his complete recovery.

title: IND vs ENG: Injury blow to India? Indian pacer sports tape on bowling hand
content: Team India faces mounting challenges ahead of the crucial fourth Test against England in Manchester. Arshdeep Singh's hand injury during practice adds to existing concerns, including uncertainty around Jasprit Bumrah's availability and Rishabh Pant's finger injury. England also suffer a blow with Shoaib Bashir ruled out due to a finger fracture.

title: Nimisha Priya death row: Consular access provided; MEA says in touch with friendly nations
content: Nimisha Priya, a nurse from Kerala, faced a death sentence in Yemen. The execution, initially set for July 16, 2025, has been postponed. The Indian government is providing assistance to her family. They are exploring a blood money settlement under Yemeni law. Officials are in contact with local authorities and friendly governments.

title: NCERT calls Babur brutal: What history‚Äôs shifting lens reveals about the Mughal emperor
content: NCERT‚Äôs new Class 8 textbook calls Babur ‚Äúbrutal and ruthless,‚Äù sparking debates among students and scholars. But history‚Äôs view of the Mughal emperor has always been a shifting kaleidoscope‚Äîfrom Baburnama‚Äôs poetic warlord to British colonial critiques, and modern takes by Dalrymple and Maldahiyar. This article dives into centuries of contrasting portrayals and asks: Are students ready to meet Babur not as a hero or villain‚Äîbut as both?

title: Shocking! Pakistan's Nadeem hits out at false promises: 'Every plot announcement was ...'
content: Pakistani Olympic champion Arshad Nadeem, who won gold at the Paris Games, has voiced concerns over unfulfilled promises of land plots made after his victory. Despite receiving cash prizes, the plot announcements remain unfulfilled. Nadeem recently underwent successful muscle surgery in the UK for a calf injury and is preparing for the World Championships.

title: Great Indian Kapil Show 3: Kapil Sharma reveals Ravi Kishan touches wife's feet everyday
content: The Great Indian Kapil Show is back with a new season. The Son Of Sardar 2 team will appear on the show. Ajay Devgn is seen in high spirits in the promos. He cracks jokes and pulls Kapil Sharma's leg. Krushna Abhishek, Kiku Sharda, and Sunil Grover also entertain the audience. Son Of Sardar 2 releases on July 25.

title: Lalu Yadav moves SC: Dismissal of proceedings sought in land-for-Job case; hearing on July 18
content: Lalu Prasad Yadav has approached the Supreme Court. This action follows the Delhi High Court's rejection of his request. He sought a stay on proceedings in the land-for-job case. The case involves alleged appointments made during his tenure as railway minister. He claims the FIR was delayed. He also alleges political motivation behind the investigation.

title: Bryan Braman dies: Former Eagles LB & Super Bowl champion loses cancer battle
content: The NFL community mourns the loss of Bryan Braman, the former Philadelphia Eagles linebacker and Super Bowl champion, who passed away at 38 after a private battle with cancer. Known for his relentless special teams play and unwavering loyalty, Braman's journey from an undrafted player to a key member of the Eagles' Super Bowl LII-winning team inspired many.

title: Gunmen walk into ICU, open fire, flee: Murder convict shot dead in Patna hospital
content: A shocking shooting occurred at Patna's Paras Hospital. CCTV footage shows assailants killing a murder convict. The incident triggered strong political reactions. Opposition parties criticize Nitish Kumar's government. They allege a breakdown of law and order in Bihar. Leaders demand investigation and accountability. Another murder reported in Shahpur locality. Concerns rise over increasing crime rates in the state.

title: Starstruck! 14-yo Suryavanshi lost in cricket's greatness; video goes viral
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old Indian cricketer, is making waves in England. He is part of the India U19 team. Suryavanshi played a key role in the Youth ODI series win. He also scored a half-century in the 1st Youth Test. The team visited Lord's, soaking in the history. Suryavanshi admired portraits of various cricket legends.

title: UIDAI plans simplifying offline Aadhaar for citizen KYC; safer, user-friendly process
content: The UIDAI is enhancing offline Aadhaar-based KYC to boost security and user-friendliness across financial services. This initiative aims to allow KYC completion without sharing Aadhaar numbers or personal details, promoting privacy. By promoting QR codes and PDFs, UIDAI simplifies the verification process and encourages compliant adoption among startups and financial providers.

title: Reverse switch slap or reverse switch pull? Batter plays a wild shot ‚Äì Watch video
content: Middlesex batter Luke Hollman's innovative shot against Surrey, a blend of scoop and reverse switch hit, has taken social media by storm, sparking debate over its name. Despite Hollman's unbeaten 32 and earlier taking two crucial wickets, Middlesex fell short by eight runs in their chase of Surrey's 189.

title: EXCLUSIVE: Inspired by 2006 FIFA WC glory, Italy's cricket 'underdogs' take aim at T20 WC
content: Italy, known for their exploits in football and water polo, has qualified for the 2026 ICC Men's T20 World Cup. They defeated Netherlands in the Europe Region Final. Pacer Thomas Draca expressed his excitement at the prospect of playing in India and Sri Lanka in a year's time. He sees this as a beginning for cricket in Italy.

title: Tamil Nadu elections: BJP confident of coalition govt, says Annamalai amid EPS pushback
content: Amidst political maneuvering in Tamil Nadu, BJP leader Annamalai expressed confidence in forming a coalition government, suggesting AIADMK should address concerns with Amit Shah. This follows EPS's assertion that AIADMK will independently secure victory in 2026, contradicting Shah's vision of an NDA coalition.

title: IND vs ENG | 'Really bad': Broad slams Jaiswal's poor shot selection at Lord's
content: Stuart Broad criticized Yashasvi Jaiswal's poor shot selection in the second innings of the Lord's Test, stating it opened the door for England's victory. Broad highlighted that Jaiswal's aggressive style puts pressure on the opposition, but his dismissal allowed England to control the game and ultimately win by 22 runs, taking a 2-1 lead in the series.

title: The 10 MLB trends that ruled the first half -- and whether they'll continue
content: From chaos in the AL East to emerging young sluggers, we break down the season's biggest themes and what we should expect down the stretch run.

title: Sources: Chiefs star Rice gets 30 days jail time
content: Chiefs star Rashee Rice was sentenced to 30 days of jail time and five years probation as a result of his role in a multi-car crash last year, sources told ESPN.

title: NFLPA dispute emerges over lawsuit awareness
content: The NFL Players Association executive director was sued in 2011 for sexual discrimination and retaliation while at Booz Allen. But a dispute has emerged about whether the players who voted for him were aware of the lawsuit prior to his 2023 election.

title: Source: QB Richardson's shoulder believed OK
content: Colts quarterback Anthony Richardson Sr. is believed to be recovered from his recent right shoulder setback as the team prepares to report for training camp, a source told ESPN's Stephen Holder.

title: Source: Vet Miller to Commanders on 1-year deal
content: The Commanders are signing veteran defensive end Von Miller, a move designed to bolster their pass rush and increase their ability to close out games on defense.

title: Former Texans, Eagles LB Braman dies at 38
content: Former Texans and Eagles linebacker Bryan Braman has died after seeking treatment this year for a rare, aggressive form of cancer, according to his agent. He was 38.

title: Marathon WR holder suspended over doping test
content: Ruth Chepngetich, who set the marathon world record by almost two minutes at the Chicago Marathon last October, was provisionally suspended Thursday for a positive doping test.

title: Mickelson cards his best Open start since 2016
content: Phil Mickelson avoided most of the rain to card a 1-under 70 for his best opening round at an Open Championship since 2016.

content: The NBA star and Grammy Award-winning rapper made their red carpet debut at her inaugural Pete & Thomas Foundation Gala.

content: Moving the draft to All-Star week was supposed to give it some sizzle. But not one player was in attendance.

content: The GOAT created a bike ride to help tornado-damaged Alabama. No one knew what it'd do -- or how it'd end.

content: The World Cup is just one year away, so what moves, if any, should these eight USMNT players make to ensure they'll be in top form next summer?

title: Sources: Liverpool advancing in talks over Ekitike
content: Liverpool are progressing in talks to sign striker Hugo Ekitike from Eintracht Frankfurt, sources told ESPN.

title: Arsenal sign Olivia Smith in world-record transfer
content: Arsenal confirmed the signing of Olivia Smith, with sources telling ESPN that it is a world-record fee and the first ¬£1 million transfer in women's football.

title: Miami 'outclassed' as historic Messi streak ends
content: Lionel Messi's MLS record streak of scoring two goals in a game ended at five as Inter Miami CF lost 3-0 to FC Cincinnati on Wednesday night.

title: Neymar scores in 1st full match in five months
content: Santos forward Neymar scored his first league goal of the season against league leaders Flamengo on Wednesday and proclaimed the triumph as "a new beginning."

title: Sources: Wolves agree to sign CWC star Arias
content: Wolves have reached an agreement with Brazilian side Fluminense to sign Colombia winger Jhon Arias, sources have told ESPN.

title: Yamal given Messi's iconic Bar√ßa No. 10 jersey
content: Lamine Yamal has been handed the iconic Barcelona No. 10 shirt previously worn by Lionel Messi, the Catalan club confirmed Wednesday.

title: Freese 'devastated' but hungry after Mexico loss
content: USMNT goalkeeper Matt Freese said he felt devastated following the Gold Cup final loss to Mexico, but insists it will be motivation for the World Cup.

title: Revitalized Sweden pose serious threat to England
content: Three years ago when the teams met, the score was one-sided. This Swedish team is a different proposition, though.

content: Timothy Bradley Jr. shares his thoughts about fighting Manny Pacquiao and breaks down Saturday's fight.

content: Paris Saint-Germain goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma is a target for Man City and Bayern Munich. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

content: On a night full of firsts, none resonated as much as the finale -- and Kyle Schwarber's titanic performance.

title: Andhra Pradesh to see fairly widespread rainfall till July 24
content: State records 38% deficit rainfall since arrival of monsoon, with the exception of six districts which received normal rainfall; four districts record a large shortfall

title: Drift in India‚Äôs foreign policy a matter of serious concern; time for course correction: Congress
content: Opposition party flags the matter of India abstaining on the UN Resolution on Gaza ceasefire, and Indo-U.S. trade deal as key concerns

title: Karnataka government decides to undo denotification
content: Despite the rule, denotification was taken up, which is illegal. Action will be initiated against officials who were responsible for the illegal act: H.K. Patil

title: Rahul Gandhi to inaugurate second death anniversary of Oommen Chandy
content: The visit is anticipated to significantly energise Congress party‚Äôs rank and file ahead of the local body elections later this year and the Assembly elections next year

title: CISF trains with Army as security at Parliament; other critical installations enhanced post Operation Sindoor
content: An official said CISF personnel deployed for Parliament security are being trained with the Army to combat terrorist strikes, drone attacks and internal sabotage

title: Amrabad now has 36 tigers
content: The monitoring for the previous year estimated the tiger population at 33; a total of 1,594 camera traps were in place in the reserve between December 20, 2024 and May 15, 2025

title: No permission to install idol on Sabarimala premises, TDB tells HC
content: Travancore Devaswom Board says it had not granted anyone the permission to collect money in this regard

title: Coconut oil prices singe household budgets in Kerala
content: A pricey Onam season on the cards as the price of a litre of coconut oil is expected to be between ‚Çπ500 and ‚Çπ600 during the festival season

title: Southern Railway to roll out Kavach on Ernakulam-Shoranur stretch
content: The project, which is expected to cost ‚Çπ105.8 crore, is to be completed in 18 months in the 106.8 km-long corridor

title: Bihar electoral roll revision: ECI says information on voters being shared with political parties
content: The move will help to re-verify names of those who have permanently shifted, are deceased or have enrolled at multiple places, says poll body

title: Defence Secretary lauds mountaineering expeditions to Mt. Everest and Mt. Kilimanjaro
content: Rajesh Kumar Singh praised the indomitable spirit of both teams, highlighting their mission not only about scaling the peaks but also to showcase India‚Äôs mountaineering excellence and leadership in adventure sports

title: Cabinet nod for constructing protective seawall on Pozhiyoor-Kollemcode stretch
content: This has been a long-pending demand of fisherfolk along the stretch since sea erosion and beach depletion have been endangering their lives and properties

title: Thiruvananthapuram Corporation achieves Water Plus status in Swachh Survekshan rankings
content: Corporation authorities say that the achievement is a result of the efforts taken to ensure scientific treatment of septage and sewerage waste. Eight municipalities in State have secured ranks in the top 100 cleanest cities in the country

title: 17 Municipal Corporations will be declared as plastic-free by next October, says CS
content: Awareness should be created about the harm posed by single-use plastic items, K. Vijayanand tells Collectors and calls upon the manufacturers to pay due attention to curb the menace

title: Kerala municipalities improve rankings in national cleanliness survey, eight in top 100
content: At the top of municipalities from the State was Kochi Corporation at rank 50 among all local bodies in the country.  The other municipalities from Kerala among the top 100 are¬†Mattannur (rank 53), Thrissur Corporation (58), Kozhikode Corporation (70), Alappuzha municipality (80), Guruvayur municipality (82), Thiruvananthapuram Corporation (89) and Kollam

title: Shifting of Atmospheric Sciences dept. to main Cusat campus opposed
content: The strength of the programme lies in its natural and necessary integration with other Earth Science disciplines such as Physical Oceanography and Geology, which are housed on the Marine campus, say a section of the faculty, students, and alumni of the department

title: We don‚Äôt want confrontation with Telangana on river water sharing, says Naidu
content: Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu calls for the two Telugu States to adopt ‚Äògive and take‚Äô policy to resolve issues; the water that starts from the footsteps of Mallanna will be taken to Venkanna, this is not just inter-linking of rivers but also Gods, he says after releasing water

title: "Don't Feel Any Pressure...": Minister On US Sanctions Threat Over Russian Oil
content: India on Thursday played down the threat of the US imposing sanctions on countries buying Russian oil, saying it is confident of meeting its needs from alternative sources.

title: Man Arrested For Killing Bihar Gangster At Hospital, All Accused Identified: Cops
content: The first arrest has been made in Bihar's hospital murder in which five men armed with guns walked into the Paras Hospital and shot a man dead who was undergoing treatment.

title: Video: BJP, NCP Workers Clash On Maharashtra Assembly Premises
content: A scuffle broke out between BJP MLA Gopichand Padalkar and NCP (Sharad Pawar group) MLA Jitendra Awhad's supporters in the lobby of the Maharashtra Legislative Assembly today.

title: Man Kidnapped, Dragged Into Baleno In UP, Cops Free Him After Chase
content: A man was seen casually typing away on his phone, unaware of the fate that awaited him a few seconds away.

title: Ex-Leader Of Banned Militant Group, AAP, Congress Leaders Join BJP In Assam
content: In a significant development ahead of the 2026 Assam Assembly elections, over 50 leaders from various political parties and socio-cultural organisations joined the Bharatiya Janata Party today.

title: 19 Killed In Lightning Strikes In Bihar In Last 24 Hours
content: At least 19 people were killed in lightning strikes in Bihar in the last 24 hours, the chief minister's office said on Thursday.

title: Siddaramaiah Flags Faulty Kannada-English Translations On Facebook, Instagram
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has flagged "faulty" auto translation of content from Kannada to English on Meta's platforms like Facebook and Instagram, and termed it "dangerous".

title: "Rahul Gandhi Encouraged...": Himanta Sarma After 1 Killed In Assam Eviction Drive
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Thursday accused Congress leader Rahul Gandhi of encouraging encroachers and emboldening them with his words to attack security forces in Goalpara, leading to the death of one illegal settler.

title: Enforcement Directorate's 1st Chargesheet Against Robert Vadra In Gurugram Land Deal Case
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has filed a chargesheet against businessman Robert Vadra and 11 others in a Gurugram land deal case. He faces three cases, and this is the first chargesheet.

title: Watch: Commandos Rappel Down From Chopper On 5-Star Hotel In Delhi For Anti-Terror Drills
content: Delhi Police organised a two-day mock drill in New Delhi starting on Thursday to check anti-terror preparedness in the national capital. Today, the drill was conducted at Claridges - a five-star hotel in Lutyens Delhi, Hindu College.

title: BJP vs AAP Over Arvind Kejriwal's "High-End" Mobile Phones
content: Delhi minister and BJP leader Ashish Sood has alleged that former chief minister Arvind Kejriwal and ex-deputy chief minister Manish Sisodia purchased multiple high-end mobile phones during their tenure, flouting government spending limits.

title: Indian Origin Man Charged In Canada For Threatening To Kill Brampton Mayor
content: An Indian origin man was arrested in Canada for allegedly threatening to kill Brampton Mayor Patrick Brown.

title: "Caution Against Double Standards": India On NATO's Russia Trade Warning
content: The Ministry of External Affairs on Thursday responded to North Atlantic Treaty Organisation (NATO) chief Mark Rutte's remarks on possible sanctions over India's trade with Russia, cautioning against "double standards".

title: Woman Changes Name, Evades Law For 20 Years In Rs 8-Crore Fraud Case, Arrested
content: Using tech to identify an accused who had evaded the law for nearly 20 years, the CBI has arrested a woman who was accused in a Rs 8-crore bank fraud case.

title: Fact Check: After Indian Woman Caught Shoplifting In US, Old Video From Mexico Is Viral
content: A video of a woman in handcuffs on her wrists is being circulated online, with users claiming that she was caught red-handed in the United States while stealing clothes. In the video she is being labelled as an India tourist who shoplifted at Target.

title: Days After Immolation, Another Professor Sexually Abuses Student In Odisha
content: Days after a student set herself on fire at a college in Odisha, a university is now under the scanner after one of its professors was arrested for allegedly sexually abusing a student.

title: RCB Slams Tribunal Order On Bengaluru Stampede, Asks Court To Expunge Portions
content: The Royal Challengers Bengaluru has strongly objected to the claim of the Central Administrative Tribunal that it was responsible for the stampede outside Bengaluru's Chinnaswamy stadium in which 11 people were killed and 56 injured.

title: Drone Strikes Norwegian Oilfield In Iraq, 2nd Such Attack This Week
content: A drone attack targeted an oilfield operated by Norwegian oil and gas firm DNO in Tawke, in the Zakho Administration area of northern Iraq

title: 1563 Indians Deported From US Since Jan 20 This Year: Foreign Ministry
content: The Ministry of External Affairs on Thursday confirmed that approximately 1,563 Indian nationals have been deported from the United States since January 20, 2025, the day Donald Trump assumed office as US President for a second term.

title: Opinion: Blog | Why Radhika Yadav Case Should Force Us To Redefine 'Honour' Killings
content: That people have turned Radhika's case into a Hindu-Muslim debate on social media only shows how narrow our definition of honour killing is.

content: As part of SportsCenter's "50 States in 50 Days" tour, we're spotlighting the top boys and girls hoopers to come out of Georgia based on high school career achievements.

title: Where do Taylor and Serrano land after all-women card?
content: Lots of movement after a boxing card with 17 titles on the line. Here's the latest women's pound-for-pound rankings.

title: PAC calls for Aadhaar review, flags high failure rate of biometric verification
content: Verification failures lead to wrongful exclusion of beneficiaries from welfare programmes, says Parliamentary panel headed by Congress leader; PAC also raises concerns about Aadhaar data leaks

title: Union Minister inaugurates Common Incubation Centre at IIT-Tirupati¬†
content: Objective of the centre is to support and nurture entrepreneurial initiatives in Chittoor and Tirupati regions, and it will also cater to value addition and processing of the produce which is locally available in abundant quantities such as tomatoes and mangoes

title: A year later, Wayanad landslides survivors tell a tale of resilience
content: Heart-wrenching scenes await one at Puthumala in Meppadi village panchayat of Wayanad district, even one year after the massive landslide that took away 298 lives and all the earthly possessions of the villagers. Abdul Latheef Naha meets some of the survivors to bring home their stories of resilience and struggle to resume their lives, which were wrecked by the natural disaster last year

title: Govt. reaches out to crisis-hit Totapuri mango and cocoa farmers in Andhra Pradesh
content: In a major market intervention measure, it allows the Director of Horticulture & Sericulture to procure 6.50 lakh tonnes of Totapuri variety and 2,977 tonnes of unsold cocoa beans for the current season

title: CPI Idukki district assistant secretary P. Palanivel passes away
content: He has served as Devikulam block panchayat president, Idukki district panchayat president, CPI State council member and Devikulam Estate Workers Union secretary

title: ‚Çπ69 lakh penalty imposed for illegal discharge of sewage into Vembanad, Ashtamudi lakes
content: Over 2,000 illegal outlets were sealed, and more than 500 institutions were found operating without sewage treatment plants

title: A week after fire, Ayyankuzhi residents refuse to return home
content: The district administration is busy making arrangements to organise a Chief Secretary-level meeting to address the long-standing demands of residents sandwiched between HOCL and BPCL-KR

title: Give priority to sanitation to safeguard public health, Sedam officials told
content: The Kalaburagi Deputy Commissioner lays emphasis on preparing for potential flooding during inspection in the town

title: Kochi to get 300 CCTV cameras for round-the-clock monitoring of waste dumping, crime hotspots
content: Thalassery-based firm to install 150 cameras for Kochi Corporation to track and penalise illegal waste dumping, and another 150 to aid Kochi City police in monitoring crime; the cameras, connected to a centralised control room in Thevara, will receive live footage

title: Centre approves NLCIL‚Äôs ‚Çπ7,000-crore investment in renewable energy arm
content: According to NLCIL, the approval would help the company strengthen India‚Äôs global position in green energy leadership; reduce India‚Äôs coal imports and carbon footprint; ensure reliable 24x7 power supply through clean sources; generate large-scale direct and indirect employment, and promote inclusive socio-economic development in project regions

title: Bommai tells banks to provide financial guidance to micro, medium industries
content: He was chairing a District Consultative Committee and District Level Review Committee meeting of the Lead Bank in Gadag

title: Tourism at Malarikkal blossoms into sustainable model for farmer income
content: As per pact between polder committees and country boat owners, a part of the revenue generated from tourism will be utilised for upkeep of fields, to repair bunds and to strengthen outer embankments

title: Himalayan Forest Research Institute holds workshop on All India Coordinated Research Projects
content: The event saw discussions on projects related to establishing a fodder bank, poplar trees and fruit trees

title: Govt. considering proposal to allow ‚Äòpermit room‚Äô at licensed liquor outlets in Andhra Pradesh
content: It is to avoid inconvenience to the general public from those having liquor on roads and to strengthen law and order, say sources

title: State govt. mulls ban on toddy shops within ORR limits
content: A total of 454 toddy shops functioning under 390 cooperative societies will be shut down if the proposal goes through

title: Fugitive in 2020 twin murder case arrested from Bengaluru
content: He was wanted in connection with the murder of Mohammed Sali and his wife Sheeba Sali near Kottayam. Though arrested earlier, he absconded during the trial

title: Stolen 150-year-old kalash from Ahmedabad‚Äôs Sarkhej Roza recovered, four held
content: The artefact was installed on the dome of the mausoleum of Sheikh Ahmad Khattu Ganj Bakhsh ‚Äî the spiritual mentor of Sultan Ahmad Shah, founder of Ahmedabad

title: From exile to home: Tribal families reclaim roots in Gujarat village after a decade
content: The event was marked by symbolic rituals, heartfelt gestures of reconciliation, and a firm governmental commitment to integrate members of the Kodarvi community back into the mainstream with dignity and support

title: Legal action from September against land encroachers in Idukki

title: How Gavin McKenna's Penn State commitment shifted the NHL prospect landscape
content: Gavin McKenna is a young offensive star for the NHL to market . he amassed 129 points in 56 games with the Medicine Hat Tigers last season . the 17-year-old phenom could have remained in the CHL for another year .

title: Diogo Jota mural completed near Liverpool stadium
content: a new mural in tribute of Diogo Jota has been completed near anfield . the mural is one of the many fan tributes outside anfield to the teen . it shows the youngster in a moment of celebration with his hands depicting a heart .

title: Full list of every ESPYS 2025 Award winner
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One celebrates the greatest athletes and moments in sports . the show is underway on ABC and ESPN+ . find out who won here . click here for all the latest capital one news .

title: Joel Embiid sees you
content: Kendrick Perkins: Embiid feels pressured to play through injury showcases trust issues . he says he's leaning back on a couch that seemed spacious until he eased his long body onto it . his son, Arthur, peeks around corners from the hallway to see what we're up to .

title: Expert picks, best bets for UFC 318
content: the two fighters first met at featherweight in Holloway's UFC debut in 2012 . the pair had grown into two of the most popular fighters on the roster . they will have another belt at stake, the final in their history-making trilogy on Saturday at UFC 318 in new Orleans .

title: WNBA refs criticized for inconsistency in how games are called
content: the WNBA is facing increasing pressure to address one of the biggest issues that has emerged as a storyline in the first half of the season . players and coaches say they aren't asking for perfection, but they want greater consistency in how games are refereed and the level of physicality allowed . the issue has flared several times during games and has prompted questions and comments during postgame news conferences .

title: Is fighting at home in New Orleans an advantage for Dustin Poirier at UFC 318?
content: Dustin Poirier chose Max Holloway to be his final opponent . he was a lightweight, his natural weight class, after cutting an extra 10 pounds to featherweight . poirier derived his most palpable jubilation that night from what he said to him immediately after the fight .

title: Evolution of WNBA All-Star Game uniforms
content: the 2025 WNBA All-Star Game reaches its 26-year milestone this weekend . caitlin Clark and Napheesa Collier are team captains after finishing as the top two fan vote-getters . each of them drafted their respective team on July 8 setting the stage for a matchup .

title: Ex-world No. 2 Jabeur to take break from tennis
content: ons Jabeur says she is taking a break from competitive tennis . the 30-year-old is the first arab woman to reach a grand Slam final . she has struggled with her form in recent months, failing to reach the third round of a major .

title: The 20 most interesting storylines at NFL training camps
content: christmas is in December, is four weeks long and comes with a present nearly every single day . it's just around the corner, with veteran players for the Chargers and Lions reporting to camp . there's little I look forward to more than the first video to hit my timeline .

title: Sights and sounds from the first round of the Open Championship
content: Scottie Scheffler discusses his desire to keep playing golf, but it isn't the source of fulfillment in his life. (1:22) The 153rd Open Championship has started at Royal Portrush Golf Course in Northern Ireland.  Xander Schauffele  looks to defend his 2024 championship, but he'll undoubtedly have competition from  Scottie Scheffler  (PGA Championship),  Rory McIlroy  (the Masters) and  J.J. Spaun  (U.S. Open), who won golf's other major championships this year. They'll also all have to battle the weather, as heavy rain is expected late Thursday. Here are the best moments from the first round of the 2025 Open Championship. Justin Leonard delights the crowd with a chip-in on the 3rd for birdie.  pic.twitter.com/fkxDnM6yDO Chip-in to tie the lead! @MattFitz94  is 4-under thru 16  @TheOpen . üì∫ Watch live now on USA Network. pic.twitter.com/0RxkXBEXxQ Scottie Scheffler with the early birdie  @TheOpen . üì∫ Watch live now on  @USANetwork .  pic.twitter.com/IiWvjB67f0
